Package com.northeastern.labyrinth.Model.GameState

Interface IRefereeState

All Superinterfaces:
IPlayerState<PrivatePlayerData>
All Known Implementing Classes:
RefereeState
public interface IRefereeState extends IPlayerState<PrivatePlayerData>
Total knowledge the Referee knows of the game state. The referee state extends the knowledge built in a IPlayerState by adding methods on private information.

  • Method Details

    • performMove

      IRefereeState performMove(Action action)
      Performs a rotation, slide and movement of the current player. If the player is now on their goal tile AND has performed an action, updates that they have reached their goal tile.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to perform.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state.

    • kickOutCurrentPlayer

      IRefereeState kickOutCurrentPlayer()
      Removes from the PrivatePlayerData queue the first player entry.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state.

    • kickOutPlayer

      IRefereeState kickOutPlayer(IPlayer player)
      Removes from the PrivatePlayerData queue the given player and his corresponding player entry.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state

    • currentTargetTile

      Coordinate currentTargetTile()
      Checks if the player's current position is on its goal tile.

    • moveCurrentPlayer

      IRefereeState moveCurrentPlayer(Coordinate coordinate)
      Moves the active player to a new desired location on the board. Updates the player´s data after the move to represent the target/home tile status.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the new location of the player.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state

    • setNextPlayer

      IRefereeState setNextPlayer()
      Sets the active player to the next player in the list
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state

      int numberOfPlayers()
      Retrieves the number of players the game state is holding information for

    • getCurrentPlayerData

      Extracts the player data class of the current player.

    • getPlayerState

      IPlayerState<PublicPlayerData> getPlayerState()
      Returns:
      An IPlayerState interface version of the current referee state with PublicPlayerData, to be provided to the players.

    • assignPlayerToPlayerData

      IRefereeState assignPlayerToPlayerData(List<IPlayer> playerList)
      Assigned the participant players to playerData.
      Parameters:
      playerList - the size of the list should be same as the size of the list player data.
      Returns:
      the new referee state.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the list is not the same as the size of the player data list.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      IPlayer getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current IPlayer, or an empty optional if an IPlayer hasn't been assigned to the current PlayerData.
      Returns:
      the participant player assigned to current player data if it exists, or the empty optional if it doesn't.

    • rotateSpare

      IRefereeState rotateSpare(int degree)
      Returns a GameState with the spare tile rotated counterclockwise by a degree
      Specified by:
      rotateSpare in interface IPlayerState<PrivatePlayerData>
      Parameters:
      degree - the degree to rotate the spare tile. Degrees must be multiple of 90. Negative values will rotate clockwise.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state

    • insertSpare

      IRefereeState insertSpare(SlideAction action)
      Returns a GameState with a slided row/col by inserting the spare tile, shifting all players on it. Returned GameState will have given action as its new previousAction If the player is outplaced from the board, reassigns its location to the newly inserted Tile. If the slide undoes the last slide action, throws an error
      Specified by:
      insertSpare in interface IPlayerState<PrivatePlayerData>
      Parameters:
      action - the slide action to perform.
      Returns:
      a new copy reflecting the updated referee state

    • getGoalTiles

      Queue<Coordinate> getGoalTiles()
      Getter for the queue of goal candidates.
